name: scalloped
content:
scalloped adjective
(PATTERN)
Add to word list
Add to word list
having an edge consisting of a row of curves: With its scalloped edges, the detailing on this dress is beautiful. Window dressings such as scalloped pelmets were very popular at the time.
More examplesFewer examplesThe dial is a small plastic disc with scalloped edges.The edges of the leaves are scalloped, and the veins form a mosaic pattern.Her pale cream blouse featured a tight-fitting collar of scalloped lace.The weight of the beads made the scalloped hem sway and tremble around her knees.The trees dropped to narrow sandy beaches on a scalloped shoreline.

scalloped adjective
(FOOD)
food & drink
  specialized (especially of potatoes) cut into slices and baked with milk or a sauce: Serve the fish with scalloped potatoes and green beans. Compare
dauphinois
More examplesFewer examplesMy only criticism of the meal is that the scalloped potatoes were too salty.Today's special is beef casserole with scalloped potatoes.
